Description: White marble lamp with a deep bowl body, an inturned grooved rim, and a long tapering nozzle, the tip broken. At the rear is a flat horizontal handle, pierced by a small circular hole. The raised circular base is flat below. There are traces of red paint inside the rim.
Curator's comments: Based upon clay examples of lamps similar to the Athenian Howland Type 23.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3962)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
